You make a valid point. While Thuringian is a unique and interesting dialect, it may not be as practical for non-native speakers to learn compared to Standard German or other widely spoken German dialects. Standard German is the official language of Germany, Austria, and Switzerland, and is spoken by millions of people worldwide. As such, it is more commonly taught in schools and is more widely recognized internationally.

However, for those interested in German dialects and linguistics, learning Thuringian can be a fascinating endeavor. It can deepen your understanding of the German language and culture, and give you a unique perspective on regional differences within Germany. Additionally, if you plan to live, work, or travel in the Thuringia region of Germany, knowing Thuringian can help you better communicate with the local people and immerse yourself in the regional culture. Ultimately, the decision to learn Thuringian, or any dialect, for that matter, depends on personal interest and motivation.
